name: furnace production, wood chips, with silo, 50kW | furnace, wood chips, with silo, 50kW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6561/documentation

This dataset represent the production and the disposal of a wood chips burning furnace with a storage silo, typical for central heating system.

From reception of furnace components at the factory gate

This activity ends with the disposal of the device in the end of its lifetime. The dataset includes the most important materials used for the fabrication of the furnace, the accumulator hot water tank (1500 l), the screw conveyor system and the chimney flue pipes: steel, steel alloys, concrete, refractory fireclay bricks, insulating materials, cast iron, plastics, electronic, lubricating oil, paint. The dataset includes the basement for the furnace (around 6m2) and the wood chips storage silo in concrete (dimensions: 4x2.8x3m), which is assumed to be built in an external space out from an existing building. The dataset includes the land transformation and occupation and the energy and heat for the construction and the disposal of the device.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2815:Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This model of furnace is commercialized since 2010 in Europe and Switzerland and is still available on the market (end 2011)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Boiler of modern technology available on the European and Swiss market, with combustion chamber in refractory bricks. The model of reference is a wood chips boiler from brand ETA, mod. Hack 50 kW. It was compared with two other boilers with similar technology (KWB Multifire 50 kW, Lindner&Sommerauer SL-T 50 kW). Austrian technology, commericialized and manufactured also in Switzerland (Swiss brand Buderus).;Source of picture: http://www.eta.co.at/15.0.html
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: extrapolated from Austrian and Swiss data
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: literature, furnace manual available for customers, personal communication from producer and technician, measured data during wood boiler exposition
